description: From Middle English geomancy, from Medieval Latin geomantia from late Ancient Greek γεωμαντεία (geōmanteía). Equivalent to geo- +‎ -mancy.

entries.meaning: A method of divination using earth or the ground, such as interpreting markings on the ground or how handfuls of dirt land when tossed.
examples: Hard by here, in the Brown-wheat-Island, dwelleth Her Trippa; you know how by the Arts of Astrology, Geomancy, Chiromancy, Metopomancy, and others of a like stuff and nature, he foretelleth all things to come...
